perturbation.original_text:
9.3
To remunerate HGF on the basis of thirty percent (30%) of net Company income basis on an annual basis commencing 12 months after the
first full 12-month revenue period.
perturbation.changed_text:
9.3
To remunerate HGF on the basis of thirty percent (30%) of net Company income basis on an annual basis commencing 24 months after the
first full 12-month revenue period.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding when HGF will start receiving remuneration, changing the commencement from 12 to 24 months. This inconsistency creates uncertainty about the payment schedule and impacts the financial expectations of HGF.

perturbation.original_text:
17.1
All company records will be kept for a minimum of five (5) years unless otherwise required by federal or provincial law.
perturbation.changed_text:
17.1
All company records will be kept for a minimum of two (2) years unless otherwise required by federal or provincial law.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction concerning the minimum record retention period, decreasing it from five to two years. This inconsistency could create disputes regarding compliance, especially if federal or provincial law requires a longer retention period than two years but shorter than five.

perturbation.original_text:
8.1
The initial term of this Agreement shall, unless sooner terminated by consent of all parties, expires in five (5) years from the date of
Effective Date. NVOS and HGF may renew the Agreement within two (2) years of the expiry of the initial term upon mutual understanding.
perturbation.changed_text:
8.1
The initial term of this Agreement shall, unless sooner terminated by consent of all parties, expires in five (5) years from the date of
Effective Date. NVOS and HGF may renew the Agreement within six (6) months of the expiry of the initial term upon mutual understanding.
perturbation.explanation: This changes the timeframe within which the agreement can be renewed from 2 years to 6 months after the expiry of the initial term. The conflicting statements create ambiguity about the renewal window and may lead to disputes if one party attempts to renew outside the 6-month window but within the 2-year window.
